## Program Overview 
  Inspired by the wild energy of the animal kingdom, this 4-week cycle blends primal movement patterns, metabolic conditioning, and proven strength lifts. Each session features animal-themed workouts using creative conditioning formats designed for fat loss, enhanced work capacity, and muscular endurance—with a ferociously fun edge. Expect week-over-week progressions in movement complexity, intensity, and conditioning density.

Program Overview

Inspired by the wild energy of the animal kingdom, this 4-week cycle blends primal movement patterns, metabolic conditioning, and proven strength lifts. Each session features animal-themed workouts using creative conditioning formats designed for fat loss, enhanced work capacity, and muscular endurance—with a ferociously fun edge. Expect week-over-week progressions in movement complexity, intensity, and conditioning density.

# Lion Press Pride
    A push-day designed to unleash kingly upper body strength through classic compound presses and wild animal-themed conditioning.
    ## Warm-Up
5 min treadmill or row at easy pace
Then 2 rounds (for quality):
- 10 banded pull-aparts
- 10 arm circles each direction
- 8 scap push-ups
- 10 push-up to Downward Dog

## Strength or Skill
Barbell Bench Press
- 4 sets x 8 reps @ RPE 7
- Rest 2-3 min

Dumbbell Seated Shoulder Press
- 3 sets x 10 reps @ RPE 7
- Rest 90 sec

Incline Push-Ups (feet on box)
- 3 sets x 12 reps (scale to regular push-ups if needed)

## Metcon
"Savanna Circuit" (AMRAP 12 min):
- 10 push-ups
- 12 kettlebell swings (moderate)
- 14 box jumps (20/24")
- 30 sec bear crawl (down gym and back)
Scaling: Knee push-ups, step-ups, lighter kettlebell
Time Cap: 12 min

## Cool-Down
- Overhead triceps stretch: 40 sec each
- Child's pose: 60 sec
- Doorway pec stretch: 40 sec each

## Core / Optional Finisher
3 rounds (not for time):
- 15 hollow rocks
- 20 alt. V-ups

## Coaching Notes
Prioritize good pressing form and full lockout on every rep. Keep the pace high in the Metcon, but only if quality can be maintained.
### Week-over-Week Progression
- Week 1: Base weights, 4x8 pressing, 12 min AMRAP
- Week 2: Add 5-10 lbs or +2 reps/press set, 14 min AMRAP
- Week 3: Increase to 5x6 pressing sets, heavier KB or box, 12 min AMRAP
- Week 4: Deload (drop all loads by ~10%), 10 min AMRAP

# Gorilla Grip Gala
    A back and biceps-focused pull day to build a silverback-worthy upper back and bulletproof grip, all with a beastly approach.
    ## Warm-Up
5 min bike (steady)
Then 2 rounds (for quality):
- 10 banded face pulls
- 8 ring/scapular pull-ups
- 12 single-arm DB rows (light)

## Strength or Skill
Barbell Bent-Over Row
- 4 sets x 8 reps @ RPE 7.5
- Rest 2-2.5 min

Pull-Ups (Strict or Banded)
- 4 sets x max reps (stop 1-2 short of failure)
- Rest 90 sec

Alternating DB Hammer Curls
- 3 sets x 12 reps/arm

## Metcon
"King Kong Climb" (Chipper; 18 min Cap):
- 30 alligator push-ups
- 40 alternating dumbbell snatches (light)
- 500m row/bike/800m run
- 40 hanging knee raises
- 30 inverted rows (bar or rings)
Scaling: Knee push-ups, lighter DB, hanging knee raises to lying leg raises

## Cool-Down
- Lat wall stretch: 45 sec/side
- Wrist flexor stretch: 30 sec/side
- Cat-cow stretch: 60 sec

## Core / Optional Finisher
3 sets:
- 12 ab wheel rollouts (or plank walkouts)
- 20 farmer hold march steps

## Coaching Notes
Use controlled motion on rows and pulls, squeeze at peak contraction. Select scales that allow unbroken sets. Focus on grip even during core work.
### Week-over-Week Progression
- Week 1: Set base weights/reps. Chipper as prescribed.
- Week 2: +1 row set or +5-10 lbs, try to complete the chipper faster or with fewer breaks.
- Week 3: Row sets 5x6, add DB weight, more reps per pull-up set.
- Week 4: Drop loading ~10%, reduce chipper volume by 20% (if needed).

# Rhino Rampage
    A lower body session bringing rhino-level power for legs and glutes, blending heavy squats, thrusts, and a charging finisher.
    ## Warm-Up
5 min stairmaster/row
Then 2 rounds:
- 10 glute bridges
- 10 air squats
- 10 walking lunges
- 15 banded lateral steps

## Strength or Skill
Barbell Back Squat
- 4 sets x 8 reps @ RPE 7-7.5
- Rest 2-3 min

Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift
- 3 sets x 12 reps

Weighted Bulgarian Split Squat
- 3 sets x 8 reps/leg

## Metcon
"Trample Dash" (AMRAP 15 min):
- 12 goblet squats (moderate KB)
- 10 box step-overs (24/20")
- 12 alternating reverse lunges
- 150m run or 250m row (fast)
Scale: Bodyweight squats/lunges, low box or step-ups, short row/run

## Cool-Down
- Seated hamstring stretch: 45 sec/side
- Quad stretch: 30 sec/side
- Pigeon pose: 40 sec/side

## Core / Optional Finisher
2 sets (not for time):
- 20 bird-dogs
- 30 sec side plank/side

## Coaching Notes
Keep squat depth consistent. Push for controlled lunges on split squats. Conditioning is leg-heavy, pace out the run/row.
### Week-over-Week Progression
- Week 1: Establish baseline, 4x8 squat
- Week 2: Add 5-10 lbs or 1-2 reps/squat, 16 min AMRAP
- Week 3: Back squat to 5x6 @ RPE 8, increase KB, 14 min AMRAP
- Week 4: Deload, 3x8 at -20% weight, 12 min AMRAP

# Full Body Forest Frolic
    A playful full-body blend mimicking a nimble trip through the wild, combining push, pull, and legs for a high-volume finisher.
    ## Warm-Up
5 min row/ski/bike
Then 2 rounds:
- 10 PVC passthroughs
- 10 kangaroo hops (vertical hops)
- 10 bodyweight good mornings

## Strength or Skill
Alternating Circuit (3 rounds for quality):
- 10 DB push press (moderate)
- 10 pull-ups or banded rows
- 16 alternating walking lunges (DBs optional)
Rest as needed between rounds

## Metcon
"Frolic Flow" (20 min cap chiller):
4 rounds for time:
- 250m row/bike or 400m run
- 20 Russian kettlebell swings
- 15 push-ups
- 10 DB goblet squats
Scale: Lighter DB/KB, knee push-ups, march instead of run
Time Cap: 20 min

## Cool-Down
- Standing quad + opp. arm stretch: 30 sec/side
- Shoulder/pec wall stretch: 45 sec/side
- Frog pose: 40 sec

## Core / Optional Finisher
Not for time: 3x
- 15 deadbugs
- :30 hollow hold

## Coaching Notes
Keep pace fun and steady—playful, not punishing. Use lighter loads and keep movement quality high. This day is designed to accumulate volume and movement variety.
### Week-over-Week Progression
- Week 1: All as written, aim for completion
- Week 2: Add round or increase loading (lightly)
- Week 3: Reduce rest time between circuit rounds
- Week 4: Maintain good form and reduce loads for recovery

# Cheetah Chase
    Engine/conditioning day built for pure speed and stamina—light, fast, and fun, channeling your inner cheetah for caloric burn and lung power.
    ## Warm-Up
5 min run/bike (easy)
Then 2 rounds:
- 20 jumping jacks
- 10 alternating spiderman lunges
- 15 kettlebell deadlifts (light)

## Metcon
"Cheetah Circuit" (EMOM 18 min):
Minute 1: 12 calorie row/bike or 15 burpees
Minute 2: 15 wall balls (20/14 lbs)
Minute 3: 20 box jumps (step down)
Continue sequence for 6 total cycles.
Scale: Jumping air squats for box, lighter wall ball, reduce reps as needed
Time Cap: 18 min

## Cool-Down
- Supine twist stretch: 45 sec/side
- Cobra stretch: 45 sec
- Standing forward fold: 60 sec

## Core / Optional Finisher
2 rounds:
- 30 sec mountain climbers
- 20 flutter kicks

## Coaching Notes
Move fast but steady—engine work = pace discipline! Keep form sharp under fatigue. This EMOM should be brutal but sustainable.
### Week-over-Week Progression
- Week 1: Prescribed reps, 18 min EMOM
- Week 2: +2 reps per movement if possible, keep pace
- Week 3: Add 20 min EMOM or choose a DB thruster instead of wall balls
- Week 4: 15 min EMOM, reduce reps 10%, focus on speed
